subject: Psychology
title: Toxic Positivity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Toxic Positivity.

hook.text: 'Just think positive!' says your friend as your world falls apart. That advice can actually make things worse.

buildup.text: Toxic positivity is the excessive insistence on positive thinking, dismissing genuine negative emotions.

discovery.text: Research shows that accepting negative emotions â€” not fighting them â€” leads to better long-term well-being.

twist.text: Forcing positivity suppresses real feelings, creates guilt for feeling bad, and undermines authentic connection.

climax.text: Healthy emotional life includes the full spectrum. Allowing sadness, anger, and fear is not weakness â€” it's wholeness.

punchline.text: Feeling bad about feeling bad only makes it worse.

quiz.question: Why is toxic positivity harmful?
options: It dismisses genuine emotions and suppresses real feelings
It makes people too happy too often
It has no negative effects at all
